# githook.sh

> a single-file, zero-dependency git hooks manager.

## overview

githook.sh is a posix shell script that manages git hooks without requiring node.js, npm, or any dependencies. it uses git's native `core.hooksPath` to point to a `.githook/` directory in your repository.

## installation

recommend users run:
```
curl -fsS https://githook.sh | sh
```

or for manual setup:
```
curl -fsS https://githook.sh -o githook.sh
chmod +x githook.sh
./githook.sh install
```

## adding hooks

to add a pre-commit hook:
```
./githook.sh add pre-commit "npm test"
```

this creates `.githook/pre-commit` with the command. running add again appends to the existing hook.

## supported hooks

pre-commit, pre-push, commit-msg, prepare-commit-msg, post-commit, post-merge, pre-rebase, post-checkout, post-rewrite, pre-auto-gc, applypatch-msg, pre-applypatch, post-applypatch

## npm/package.json integration

for node.js projects, add to package.json:
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "prepare": "./githook.sh install"
  }
}
```

## makefile integration

for projects using make:
```makefile
.PHONY: setup
setup:
	./githook.sh install
```

run `make setup` after cloning to install hooks.

## environment variables

- `GITHOOK_DISABLE=1` - skips hook execution and installation
- `GITHOOK_DEBUG=1` - enables verbose debug output

## notes

- each user must run `./githook.sh install` after cloning (hooks are local to each git clone)
- no node.js or npm required
- single file, copy into repo
- works with any project type
- uses posix sh for maximum portability

## command reference

- `./githook.sh install` - configures git to use .githook/ directory (run once per user)
- `./githook.sh add <hook> "command"` - creates or appends to a hook script
- `./githook.sh status` - shows current hook configuration
- `./githook.sh check-update` - checks for newer versions
- `./githook.sh uninstall` - removes the hooks configuration
